data.title: James Brokenshire obituary
data.meta_description: Clean-cut and popular Conservative minister for housing and later security
data.text:
Not since Ed “two kitchens” Miliband had an honourable member of parliament come under such scrutiny for his culinary arrangements. The question preoccupying the nation was: did James Brokenshire’s kitchen have two ovens or four?

The issue arose after a Sunday Times profile in 2019 in which the housing secretary was photographed at his otherwise ordinary postwar home in southeast London carrying a Victoria sponge cake. “I hate it when, come Christmas, there’s not enough room in the oven,” said his wife, Cathy, by way of explanation, though were it not for their oven collection the nation’s fixation might instead have been on the family’s two dishwashers.

The photograph emerged at a time when at least 1.17 million homes were needed for “trapped renters”. A
